message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about electromagnets. An electromagnet contains a cylindrical core, typically made of iron or steel. This core is used to enhance the magnetic field created by the flow of electric current through the coil of wire wrapped around it. Option (B) is incorrect because wind is not a component of an electromagnet. Option (C) is also incorrect because water is not involved in the construction or function of an electromagnet.
